## Query.updateOne() method

Based on the query, first matched document will be updated

**Signature:**

```typescript
updateOne(query: UpdateQuery, payload: DocumentType | ((param: DocumentType) => DocumentType), options?: IQueryUpdateManyOptions): this;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

query


</td><td>

UpdateQuery


</td><td>

Update query to find match


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

payload


</td><td>

DocumentType \| ((param: DocumentType) =&gt; DocumentType)


</td><td>

New document or Callback to update the found document


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

options


</td><td>

IQueryUpdateManyOptions


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Query options


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

this


## Example


```ts
const query = new Query(idb, "store-name");
await query.updateOne({ $key: key }, newDoc, options);
```
